etymology.description: Depicts a bronze bell -> lower part evolved to 用(用) (yòng, 'use') for phonetic purposes
etymology.interpretation: The character 甬 originally depicted a bronze bell, and over time the lower part of the bell was stylized to resemble the character 用(用) (yòng, 'use'), serving as a phonetic component. Despite its resemblance to 用(用) and 角(角) (jiǎo, 'horn'), 甬 is unrelated to these characters.

examples.chinese: 宴会上他举起甬(宴會上他舉起甬)，热情地致意(熱情地致意)。
examples.pinyin: Yànhuì shàng tā jǔqǐ yǒng, rèqíng de zhìyì.
examples.english: At the banquet, he raised the wine cup and greeted everyone enthusiastically.

examples.chinese: 他轻轻端起甬(他輕輕端起甬)，感受着历史的余香(感受著歷史的餘香)。
examples.pinyin: Tā qīngqīng duānqǐ yǒng, gǎnshòuzhe lìshǐ de yúxiāng.
examples.english: He gently picked up the wine cup, savoring the lingering aroma of history.

examples.chinese: 古人以精美的甬作酒具(古人以精美的甬作酒具)，传颂文化(傳頌文化)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔrén yǐ jīngměi de yǒng zuò jiǔjù, chuánsòng wénhuà.
examples.english: The ancients used exquisitely crafted wine cups as vessels to celebrate their culture.
